title: In Praise of Idleness — Bertrand Russel
description:
A great essay, as relevant to day as when it was written back in 1932. Includes one of my favourite jokes
First of all: what is work? Work is of two kinds: first, altering the position of matter at or near the earth's surface relatively to other such matter; second, telling other people to do so.

title: The Tyranny of Structurelessness — Jo Freeman
description: A powerful argument that invisible structures flourish on organisations without explicit structure. An argument which should ring true for anyone who's ever experienced the politics of a school playground. We've seen plenty of this in the notionally flat organisations of Silicon Valley
The best board game site! Funny and insightful. The podcast is probably my favourite bit.

title: Alice Bartlett
description: I had the pleasure to work with Alice at the FT. Her Weaknotes blog is an inspiration, she has a real knack for condesing ideas and events into engaging bullet points

title: Freaky Trigger
description: A veritable institution! The core is Tom Ewings magnificent Popular series, a truely epic undertaking; to review each and every UK number one single.

title: A Complete Guide to Flexbox
description: I visit this page a lot. Like much of CSS flex box never seems to click for me, I suspect that I just don't use it enough for it to become automatic.

title: Children's Bookshop - Muswell Hill
Decription: This little bookshop is an absolute gem. Fantastic stock but more importantly extremely knowlegable and helpfull staff.

description: An inspiration both in terms of general apporach to web making and in particular for this here directory thing which you're raight now browsing.
